intro: Lippia aprica, commonly known as Mexican mint or sweet mint, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sunny environments and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Lippia aprica is valued for its fragrant foliage, which is used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb. It is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
